data.text:
Which one is right and which one is wrong?

We always hear the phrase “driving on the wrong side of the road” when talking about the difference between the right side and the left side.

But, I prefer to use the term “opposite” instead of “wrong” side of the road.

Who knows if there really is a right or wrong answer to this age-old question?

One could say that the right side is right since 75% of the world drives on that side.

But from history, it’s thought that driving on the left came first because of the transition from horses to cars. Carriages drove on the left so that the driver had quick access to their sword if meeting up with an adversary. Most people are right-handed.

So, if left came first may be left is right.

Now, I’m just confused.

Although the majority drive on the right, there is no global standard and many countries drive on the left.
